question: The World Wide Web and the Internet are the same thing.
Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web.
The first web browser was called Mosaic.
ARPANET is considered the earliest version of the Internet.
Email existed before the World Wide Web.
The first search engine was Google.
Yahoo was founded before Google.
HTML is a programming language.
CSS is primarily used for styling web pages.
Most modern websites run entirely without JavaScript.
SSL certificates encrypt data transmitted between user and server.
IPv6 has more available addresses than IPv4.
HTTP is a secure communication protocol.
HTTPS uses TLS or SSL for encryption.
DNS translates domain names into IP addresses.
The Internet is controlled by a single global organization.
A VPN hides your IP address from websites.
The Deep Web contains only illegal content.
The Dark Web is a small part of the Deep Web.
Cookies on websites store data in your browser.
Phishing attacks often pretend to be trusted organizations.
Two-factor authentication always uses SMS codes.
Ransomware encrypts a victim's files for payment.
A strong password includes personal information for memorability.
A firewall can block malicious traffic before it reaches your device.
Malware and viruses are the exact same thing.
Botnets consist of compromised computers controlled remotely.
Using public Wi-Fi without a VPN is completely risk-free.
Keyloggers can record everything typed on a device.
Ad blockers can help reduce malware risks.
YouTube was created before Facebook.
Reddit is known as 'the front page of the Internet'.
Instagram was launched in 2000.
Twitter originally limited posts to 140 characters.
TikTok was created by the same company that created Musical.ly.
LinkedIn is primarily used for gaming content.
Snapchat messages were originally advertised as disappearing.
Myspace was one of the most popular social networks in the mid-2000s.
Pinterest is primarily used for short-form videos.
Discord began as a platform for gamers.
The first version of Windows with Internet Explorer was Windows 95.
Chrome is built on the WebKit engine.
Firefox is open-source software.
Safari is the default browser on macOS devices.
Microsoft Edge replaced Internet Explorer.
Opera invented browser tabs.
Private browsing mode completely hides your activity from your ISP.
Most modern browsers sandbox web content.
Flash Player is still widely used on modern websites.
WebAssembly allows near-native performance inside browsers.
The term 'cloud computing' refers to remote servers accessed over the Internet.
Amazon Web Services is one of the largest cloud providers in the world.
Dropbox was originally created as a solution for forgotten USB drives.
Google Drive launched before Gmail.
iCloud is primarily a file-hosting service.
Most cloud services automatically replicate data across multiple servers.
Cloud storage files are always fully private by default.
OneDrive is a Microsoft cloud storage platform.
Streaming platforms rely heavily on cloud infrastructure.
The cloud has unlimited physical storage capacity.
A megabit is larger than a megabyte.
Bandwidth refers to the maximum data transfer rate of a network.
Latency refers to the delay in data transmission.
5G networks can deliver faster speeds than most home broadband connections.
Wi-Fi uses the same communication protocol as Bluetooth.
Fiber-optic cables transmit data using light.
Ethernet cables cannot exceed one meter in length.
Routers assign IP addresses to devices on a network.
A modem is required for connecting to an ISP.
A mesh Wi-Fi system uses a single large router.
Streaming video consumes more data than streaming audio.
Netflix originally mailed DVDs before streaming.
YouTube started as a dating website.
Twitch was originally called Justin.tv.
Spotify launched before Apple Music.
Hulu is only available in Europe.
Disney+ launched in 2019.
VR headsets require an active internet connection at all times.
4K video uses more bandwidth than 1080p video.
GIFs support more colors than JPEG images.
Blockchain technology powers some cryptocurrencies.
Bitcoin was the first digital currency ever created.
NFTs are stored on blockchain networks.
Cryptocurrency transactions cannot be traced.
Web3 is commonly associated with decentralized applications.
Blockchain data can be altered retroactively.
Ethereum introduced the concept of smart contracts.
Private keys can be recovered if lost.
Mining cryptocurrency requires computational power.
Most crypto wallets require an internet connection to function.
HTML5 introduced the <canvas> element.
JSON is a binary data format.
APIs allow software applications to communicate over the internet.
REST APIs must always return XML.
Webhooks push data automatically to receiving applications.
AJAX enables asynchronous communication with servers.
A CDN helps deliver content faster to users.
SQL is used to describe website layouts.
Caching improves website performance.
WebSockets enable persistent, two-way communication.
The first ever domain name was symbolics.com.
DNS stands for Domain Number System.
Top-level domains include .com, .org, and .net.
A subdomain appears before the main domain in a URL.
WHOIS databases contain domain ownership information.
The .gov domain can be registered by anyone.
.io domains are originally assigned to a British territory.
Unicode domain names allow the use of emojis.
A parked domain is one that receives heavy traffic.
DNS propagation happens instantly worldwide.
The first smartphone with a full web browser was the Blackberry 5810.
The iPhone popularized mobile web browsing.
Progressive Web Apps can work offline.
AMP pages were created by Facebook.
Responsive design adapts a website to different screen sizes.
Mobile browsers always support desktop features.
5G significantly improves mobile online gaming.
Mobile apps always require an internet connection to launch.
Most mobile devices can act as Wi-Fi hotspots.
Push notifications require a persistent internet connection.
Most modern websites use analytics tools to track user behavior.
SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization.
Backlinks do not affect search engine rankings.
A high bounce rate usually indicates users leave a site quickly.
Google's search algorithm has remained unchanged since its launch.
Meta descriptions directly determine ranking position.
Image alt text improves accessibility and SEO.
Page speed influences search ranking.
Keyword stuffing improves search performance.
Search engines use crawlers to index content.
E-commerce websites always require a merchant account to process payments.
The first online purchase was a pizza in the 1990s.
SSL is required for secure payment transactions.
Abandoned cart emails are used to increase sales.
A payment gateway processes online transactions.
Digital goods require physical shipping costs.
Most online marketplaces charge seller fees.
SKU stands for Stock Key Unit.
Fraud detection systems analyze transaction patterns.
Online stores cannot operate without an SSL certificate.
The Internet of Things includes smart home devices.
IoT devices always have strong built-in security.
Smart thermostats can be controlled remotely over the internet.
Wearable devices cannot connect to the internet.
IoT stands for Internet of Tools.
Smart speakers process some voice commands in the cloud.
Many IoT devices rely on Wi-Fi or Bluetooth.
IoT devices never receive firmware updates.
Industrial IoT systems monitor machinery in factories.
IoT devices always require a smartphone to function.
Most people access the internet through mobile devices today.
Cyberbullying can occur through online messaging apps.
Online anonymity is impossible to achieve.
Internet memes existed before social media.
Online forums have existed since the early days of the internet.
Influencer marketing began in the 2020s.
Crowdfunding websites allow people to fund creative projects.
Most online comments are moderated automatically using algorithms.
Digital addiction is recognized as a real issue.
Online friendships cannot be as meaningful as offline ones.
CAPTCHA challenges help distinguish humans from bots.
Spam emails make up a small fraction of global email traffic.
A DDoS attack floods a server with massive traffic.
Rootkits improve the security of your computer.
Social engineering manipulates people into revealing confidential information.
Antivirus software completely eliminates all cyber threats.
A zero-day vulnerability has no available fix at the time of discovery.
Two-step verification is the same as using two separate passwords.
Brute-force attacks try many password combinations quickly.
Encryption makes intercepted data unreadable.
The first banner ad appeared in the 1990s.
Cookies were originally invented for online advertising.
Online ads can be targeted using browsing history.
Ad impressions represent how many times an ad was clicked.
CTR stands for Click Through Ratio.
Retargeting ads show products users previously viewed online.
Banner blindness refers to users ignoring ads unconsciously.
CPM pricing charges advertisers per click.
Ad blockers can affect publisher revenue.
Pop-up ads are now banned on the entire internet.
Open-source software allows users to see and modify the source code.
Linux is a closed-source operating system.
GitHub is a platform for code hosting and collaboration.
Version control helps teams track changes to code.
JavaScript and Java were developed by the same company.
Python is commonly used for web development.
Static websites cannot display dynamic data.
Compression reduces the size of files transmitted online.
Ping tests measure network download speeds.
A proxy server can hide a userâ€™s IP address.
Most digital assistants rely on cloud-based processing.
Machine learning models can run entirely inside a browser.
Artificial intelligence existed before the internet.
Facial recognition always requires an internet connection.
Many recommendation systems use collaborative filtering.
Chatbots cannot operate offline.
Neural networks are inspired by the human brain.
AI-generated images require specialized hardware to view.
Most voice assistants store training data anonymously.
AI moderation tools help detect harmful content online.
